result.execSummary:
The defendant John Cadwell Brock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Once released, obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with B.C., or her immediate family.  Child exchange through third party only.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to consume or possess or consume any prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.

AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.
Court will allow third party to take children to visit at prison.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
